modules.description: This module implements a DNS resolver that processes DNS queries, handles responses, and manages DNSSEC validation. It works with DNS packets, IP addresses, and protocol types, maintaining internal state for ongoing resolutions and caching. It is used to perform iterative DNS resolution, handle buffer input from network sources, and manage root zone queries and timeouts.

This module implements DNS resolution with caching, handling queries, responses, and CNAME following. It processes DNS questions and replies, manages cache state, and supports DNSSEC validation. It is used to perform iterative DNS lookups, cache results, and synthesize responses from cached data.

This module defines root DNS server information and related records. It provides access to root server IP addresses, NS, A, AAAA records, and reserved DNS zones. The data structures include lists of domain names paired with IPv4/IPv6 addresses, IP sets, and a trie of reserved zones. Concrete use cases include bootstrapping DNS resolution and validating domain names against reserved ranges.

This module processes DNS packets to extract and validate resource records for caching, ensuring they fall within the specified bailiwick to prevent cache poisoning. It works with domain names, DNS packets, and resource record maps, returning filtered entries along with their cache rank or an error code. A concrete use case is validating and qualifying DNS responses before updating a resolver's cache with only legitimate records.

This module creates a caching DNS resolver that operates over UDP, TCP, or TLS, supporting both standard and encrypted DNS queries on configurable ports. It works with network stacks and DNS configurations to handle query resolution, using TTL values to manage caching behavior. It is used to implement DNS resolution services in MirageOS-based unikernels, where it processes incoming queries and returns resolved records with associated time-to-live values.

This module creates a caching DNS resolver that performs queries over UDP, TCP, or TLS, supporting standard and encrypted DNS with configurable ports. It processes incoming DNS requests and returns resolved records with TTL values, managing cache behavior based on those values. It is used to implement DNS resolution services in MirageOS unikernels, integrating with network stacks to handle query resolution efficiently.
